channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: 'We must continue': In Kabul, Afghans adjust to a new and uncertain fate
item.description: Lyse Doucet takes the temperature on the streets of the Afghan capital as the Taliban tighten their grip.

item.title: Apple delays plan to scan iPhones for child abuse
item.description: It said it had listened to feedback from privacy campaigners and others and would reassess.

item.title: Storm Ida aftermath: 'I can't even count my losses from the flooding right now'
item.description: Residents in the US north-east assess the scale of the devastation caused by Tropical Storm Ida.

item.title: US jobs growth disappoints as recovery falters
item.description: The US economy added just 235,000 jobs in August, according to the Bureau of Labour Statistics.

item.title: New Zealand PM Ardern says supermarket stabbing was 'terrorist attack'
item.description: Videos circulating online show panicked shoppers running out of a supermarket in Auckland.

item.title: Ex-cardinal pleads not guilty to sexual assault
item.description: Theodore McCarrick is believed to be the highest-ranking US Catholic to face criminal abuse charges.

item.title: EU and AstraZeneca reach deal to end vaccine row
item.description: AstraZeneca agrees to deliver 200 million doses by next spring, ending the threat of court action.

item.title: Toxic leak from Angola diamond mine kills 12 in DR Congo
item.description: The leak turned a tributary of the River Congo red and also killed many fish, a minister says.

item.title: Ahmaud Arbery: Ex-prosecutor charged with mishandling case
item.description: A former US district attorney is accused of mishandling the case of Ahmaud Arbery's death in 2020.

item.title: Jeanette Zacarias Zapata: Mexican boxer, 18, dies days after knockout in Montreal
item.description: Mexican welterweight boxer Jeanette Zacarias Zapata, 18, dies five days after being knocked out in a fight.

item.title: Finnish teenagers jailed for boy's murder
item.description: Three boys are sentenced to 10, nine and eight years over the "brutal" death of one of their peers.

item.title: Islamic State 'Beatle' Alexanda Kotey pleads guilty over US hostage deaths
item.description: Alexanda Kotey is facing life in prison over the murders of US journalists and relief workers.

item.title: Storm Ida: Before and after images of US flooding
item.description: Before and after satellite images of the devastation caused by Storm Ida in the north-east US.

item.title: Afghanistan crisis: How Europe's relationship with Joe Biden turned sour
item.description: In many EU circles, the honeymoon period for Donald Trump's successor may be coming to an end.

item.title: Shang-Chi: Why the MCU's first Asian superhero is empowering change
item.description: Shang-Chi And The Legend Of The Ten Rings sees Simu Liu front an Asian-led cast. Why does it matter?

item.title: Panjshir - the valley trying to hold off the Taliban
item.description: The last bastion of resistance is still holding out just north-east of the capital, Kabul.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The Paralympic dream that started at the supermarket
item.description: Aruba had never had a Paralympic team until a student in her 20s decided to make it happen.

item.title: Prince Andrew, Bob Dylan, Catholic priests and the Child Victims Act
item.description: Prince Andrew, Bob Dylan, Catholic priests and others face suits after a change in New York law.

item.title: Afghanistan: British Army officers tell of 'chaotic' evacuation operation
item.description: The senior British commander in Kabul speaks for the first time about the UK's evacuation operation.

item.title: Paralympics: ‘My blades helped me learn to fly’
item.description: How Ntando Mahlangu's prosthetic blades changed his life and led him to two golds at the Tokyo Paralympics.

item.title: NZ Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern's response to Auckland terror attack
item.description: Jacinda Ardern says a stabbing attack in Auckland was carried out by a person who was a "known threat".

item.title: Paddle boarder's close encounter with two curious whales
item.description: A drone filmed what the paddle boarder, out on the water on her birthday, calls a "magical moment".

item.title: How North Korea’s founding father, Kim Il-sung, came to power
item.description: Professor Kim Hyung-suk had breakfast with the man who would rule North Korea for nearly 50 years

item.title: Afghanistan: Dominic Raab says the UK has shared interest in a stable country
item.description: The foreign secretary says the UK will give £30m in aid to countries bordering Afghanistan.

item.title: Kabul make-up artist: 'Women like me are Taliban targets'
item.description: A make-up artist in hiding explains how much Afghanistan's beauty industry has meant to women.

item.title: Johnson: Kabul evacuation 'planned for months'
item.description: Boris Johnson says safe passage for those wanting to leave is a priority if the Taliban want engagement with the West.

item.title: Afghanistan: Qatar and Turkey become Taliban's lifeline to the outside world
item.description: Qatar and Turkey emerge as key channels between Afghanistan's new rulers and the outside world.
